byline.contributor: Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Atlanta.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and KAY NOLAN

abstract: Demonstrators in Milwaukee, furious over officer-involved fatal shooting of armed black man Sylville K Smith, focused their anger at news media in addition to destroying property and attacking police; news organizations have begun withdrawing their crews from streets due to threats of violence.
lead_paragraph: News organizations are removing journalists from the field and assessing how to cover the story while ensuring that reporters are not caught in the crossfire.
snippet: News organizations are removing journalists from the field and assessing how to cover the story while ensuring that reporters are not caught in the crossfire....

headline.main: Angry After Milwaukee Police Shooting, Protesters Turn Against Media, Too
headline.print_headline: Angry After Milwaukee Police Shooting, Protesters Turn Against News Media, Too
